resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
For over 89 years, Morgan Stanley has combined old school wisdom with a passion for what's possible. Doing so enables us to provide clients with exceptional service in a way that reflects our commitment to creating a more sustainable future and fostering stronger communities around the world. In each line of business, we strive to demonstrate our belief in the power of transformative thinking, innovative strategies and leading-edge solutions. Together, no challenge is unmet.

 

Global Capital Markets (GCM) responds with market judgment and ingenuity to meet clients' needs for capital. Whether executing an IPO, a debt offering or a leveraged buyout, GCM integrates Morgan Stanley's expertise in Investment Banking and in Sales & Trading, offering clients seamless advice and sophisticated solutions. We originate, structure and execute public and private placements of equity and equity-linked securities, investment-grade and non-investment-grade debt and related products.

 

Internship Programs

Realize your full potential at Morgan Stanley through our campus programs.


Our Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have the opportunity to be involved in an immersive orientation program and learn about our culture as well as the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of the Firm. You will be placed in one or more of our main product groups. You will be exposed to the deal process—including business development, origination, structuring and execution—and will gain an understanding of how the different areas of the bank including Corporate Finance, Sales & Trading, Research and Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), interact.


In addition, Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have many opportunities to exchange ideas and network with peers, mentors and senior managers through team-building sessions and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on meaningful projects during their internship. Our internship programs are designed to provide a realistic view of Global Capital Markets by having the interns assume the functions of Full-Time Analysts. Along the way, you will obtain a strong foundation in the basic skills of financial analysis and deal execution. You will be expected to start learning how to market the Firm’s products and services effectively.

 

Roles and Responsibilities

The role and responsibilities of Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts vary but may include:

  • You will spend the internship in one or more of our main product groups, building a foundation of financial skills and a solid understanding of the markets
  • The work is challenging, you are encouraged to roll up your sleeves, dig into financial statements and construct innovative solutions
  • You will have a mentor and buddy to aid in your development and to provide greater exposure to GCM and the Firm
  • You will be encouraged to take on responsibility quickly and help bridge various topics from new trends in the marketplace to group overviews
  • You will participate in a mid-point and end-point evaluation to ensure that you are honing your skills and receiving timely feedback on your performance

 

Qualifications and Skills 

  • You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelor’s or Master's degree with a graduation date between October 2026 and July 2027
  • You have an ability to manage multiple projects, provide complicated financial analysis, and develop appropriate corporate finance solutions
  • You have extraordinarily high level of motivation and attention to detail
  • You have commercial instinct and ability to perform under pressure and tight deadlines
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluency in English is required
  • Business fluency in Mandarin is preferred for the program in Hong Kong
  • Business fluency in Southeast Asian languages is an advantage for the program in Singapore

 

Internship Period 

  • Industrial Placement Program: 6 months between January to July 2026
    • Available in both Hong Kong and Singapore 
  • Summer Analyst Program: 10 weeks between June to August 2026
    • Available in Hong Kong only


Application Process and Deadline 

Application process may vary by location but typically follows:

  1. CV
  2. On-Demand Video Interview
  3. Zoom Interview + Group Discussion
  4. Superday

 

  • Application deadline #1: Sunday, August 10, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / SGT
  • Application deadline #2: Monday, September 14, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / SGT

 

Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready because interviews and offers can occur prior to the application period closing.

resultSet.jobDescription: For over 89 years, Morgan Stanley has combined old school wisdom with a passion for what's possible. Doing so enables us to provide clients with exceptional service in a way that reflects our commitment to creating a more sustainable future and fostering stronger communities around the world. In each line of business, we strive to demonstrate our belief in the power of transformative thinking, innovative strategies and leading-edge solutions. Together, no challenge is unmet. Morgan Stanley is a worldwide leader in Investment Banking. We are one of the top firms in Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), underwriting of equity transactions, corporate debt issuance, and high-yield debt financing. With professionals in 30 countries, we are consistently recognized for our performance in traditional and innovative financing techniques, helping clients around the world to make decisions about their business strategy and financial structure. Internship Programs Realize your full potential at Morgan Stanley through our campus programs. Our Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have the opportunity to be involved in an immersive orientation program and learn about our culture as well as the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of the Firm. You will participate in an intensive division-specific training program focused on developing a strong foundation in the basic skills of financial analysis, accounting and valuation, and work on a wide range of transactions. In addition, Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have many opportunities to exchange ideas and network with peers, mentors and senior managers through team-building sessions and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on meaningful projects during their internship. Our internship programs are designed to provide a realistic view of Investment Banking by having the interns assume the functions of Full-Time Analysts. Roles and Responsibilities The roles and responsibilities of Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts vary but may include: Analyzing detailed corporate and financial information Creating statistical exhibits that analyze comparative financial performance Building models to illustrate projected financial results and value to companies Developing marketing memoranda and delivering sections of research presentation Participating in the execution of financings and M&A transactions Acting as the liaison for the team and other parts of the Firm Qualifications and Skills You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelors or Master's degree with a graduation date between October 2026 and July 2027 Knowledge of and a keen interest in finance Analytical, adaptive, multi-tasker, team player; possess a strong work ethic and leadership skills Extraordinarily high level of motivation and attention to detail Commercial instinct and ability to perform under pressure and tight deadlines Strong written and verbal communication skills Fluency in English is required Business fluency in Mandarin or Korean is an advantage for the program in Hong Kong Business fluency in Bahasa Indonesia or Tagalog is an advantage for the program in Singapore Business fluency in Korean is required for the program in Seoul Internship Period Industrial Placement Program: 6 months between January to July 2026 Summer Analyst Program: 10 weeks between June to August 2026 Application Process and Deadline Application process may vary by location but typically follows: CV + Online Assessment On-Demand Video Interview Zoom Interview Superday Application deadline 1: Sunday, August 10, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / 23:55 SGT / 22:55 KST Application deadline 2: Sunday, September 14, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / 23:55 SGT / 22:55 KST Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready because interviews and offers can occur prior to the application period closing.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
For over 89 years, Morgan Stanley has combined old school wisdom with a passion for what's possible. Doing so enables us to provide clients with exceptional service in a way that reflects our commitment to creating a more sustainable future and fostering stronger communities around the world. In each line of business, we strive to demonstrate our belief in the power of transformative thinking, innovative strategies and leading-edge solutions. Together, no challenge is unmet.

 

Morgan Stanley is a worldwide leader in Investment Banking. We are one of the top firms in Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), underwriting of equity transactions, corporate debt issuance, and high-yield debt financing. With professionals in 30 countries, we are consistently recognized for our performance in traditional and innovative financing techniques, helping clients around the world to make decisions about their business strategy and financial structure.


Internship Programs

Realize your full potential at Morgan Stanley through our campus programs.

Our Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have the opportunity to be involved in an immersive orientation program and learn about our culture as well as the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of the Firm. You will participate in an intensive division-specific training program focused on developing a strong foundation in the basic skills of financial analysis, accounting and valuation, and work on a wide range of transactions.

In addition, Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts have many opportunities to exchange ideas and network with peers, mentors and senior managers through team-building sessions and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on meaningful projects during their internship. Our internship programs are designed to provide a realistic view of Investment Banking by having the interns assume the functions of Full-Time Analysts.

Roles and Responsibilities

The roles and responsibilities of Industrial Placement & Summer Analysts vary but may include:

  • Analyzing detailed corporate and financial information
  • Creating statistical exhibits that analyze comparative financial performance
  • Building models to illustrate projected financial results and value to companies
  • Developing marketing memoranda and delivering sections of research presentation
  • Participating in the execution of financings and M&A transactions
  • Acting as the liaison for the team and other parts of the Firm

Qualifications and Skills

  • You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelor’s or Master's degree with a graduation date between October 2026 and July 2027
  • Knowledge of and a keen interest in finance
  • Analytical, adaptive, multi-tasker, team player; possess a strong work ethic and leadership skills
  • Extraordinarily high level of motivation and attention to detail
  • Commercial instinct and ability to perform under pressure and tight deadlines
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluency in English is required
  • Business fluency in Mandarin or Korean is an advantage for the program in Hong Kong
  • Business fluency in Bahasa Indonesia or Tagalog is an advantage for the program in Singapore
  • Business fluency in Korean is required for the program in Seoul

 

Internship Period

  • Industrial Placement Program: 6 months between January to July 2026
  • Summer Analyst Program: 10 weeks between June to August 2026

 

Application Process and Deadline

Application process may vary by location but typically follows:

  1. CV + Online Assessment
  2. On-Demand Video Interview
  3. Zoom Interview
  4. Superday

 

  • Application deadline #1: Sunday, August 10, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / 23:55 SGT / 22:55 KST
  • Application deadline #2: Sunday, September 14, 2025 at 23:55 HKT / 23:55 SGT / 22:55 KST

Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready because interviews and offers can occur prior to the application period closing.

resultSet.jobTitle: 2025 Morgan Stanley High School Insight Week - Operations & Accountancy (Glasgow)

resultSet.jobDescription: Legal Intern (Mexico) - Job Description Summary: As a Legal Intern at Morgan Stanley, you will gain invaluable exposure and get seasoned in the complex legal and regulatory environment of the financial industry. Working closely with the General Counsel, you will assist in a wide range of activities fostering your personal and professional skills. Main Responsibilities: As part of the in-house legal department, the Legal Intern key responsibilities include: Helping to provide legal coverage to all business units including cash equities, fixed income businesses, investment banking, capital markets as well as to the different infrastructure and support functions such as Human Resources, Credit and Risk Management, Corporate Services, Operations, IT, Finance and taxes, etc. Assisting to prepare and control documentation related to the Corporate Secretary, including meetings, materials and minutes of the Board of Directors, Audit Committee and shareholders meetings, powers of attorney, etc. Collaborating closely with Compliance and Internal Control functions in implementing legal and regulatory changes; addressing regulatory and audit requirements; and the review and update of internal policies and procedures ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and global policies. Support in preparing legal analyses and completing reports in connection with legal risk management. Qualifications, Experience, Other Skills: Candidate should be in 3rd or 4th year of Law school; Proven interest in financial markets; Fluency in English (reading, writing and speaking) is recommended; Fluency in Spanish is a must Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
Legal Intern (Mexico) - Job Description Summary:

 

As a Legal Intern at Morgan Stanley, you will gain invaluable exposure and get seasoned in the complex legal and regulatory environment of the financial industry. Working closely with the General Counsel, you will assist in a wide range of activities fostering your personal and professional skills. 

 Main Responsibilities:

As part of the in-house legal department, the Legal Intern key responsibilities include:

  • Helping to provide legal coverage to all business units including cash equities, fixed income businesses, investment banking, capital markets as well as to the different infrastructure and support functions such as Human Resources, Credit and Risk Management, Corporate Services, Operations, IT, Finance and taxes, etc.
  • Assisting to prepare and control documentation related to the Corporate Secretary, including meetings, materials and minutes of the Board of Directors, Audit Committee and shareholders meetings, powers of attorney, etc.
  • Collaborating closely with Compliance and Internal Control functions in implementing legal and regulatory changes; addressing regulatory and audit requirements; and the review and update of internal policies and procedures ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and global policies.
  • Support in preparing legal analyses and completing reports in connection with legal risk management.

 

 Qualifications, Experience, Other Skills:

  • Candidate should be in 3rd or 4th year of Law school;
  • Proven interest in financial markets;
  • Fluency in English (reading, writing and speaking) is recommended;
  • Fluency in Spanish is a must
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications.

resultSet.jobTitle: 2026 Investment Management Off-cycle Internship - Real Estate Investing (London)
resultSet.jobDescription: In the Investment Management division, we deliver active investment strategies across public and private markets and custom solutions to institutional and individual investors. Since 1935, Morgan Stanley is known as a global leader in financial services, continuously evolving and innovating to better serve our clients and our communities in more than 40 countries around the world. PLACEMENT AND DURATION Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has about 1.7 trillion in assets under management or supervision. With 1,396 investment professionals worldwide, and 56 offices in 24 countries, MSIM is able to provide in-depth local knowledge and expertise while channeling the strength of our global presence and resources. To support the delivery of tailored, value-added investment solutions to clients our investment teams are organized by capability: equities, fixed income, multi-asset solutions, liquid alternatives and private markets. MSIM strives to provide outstanding long-term investment performance, service and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations and individuals worldwide. Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing (REI) is Morgan Stanley's integrated global real estate practice. We are the world's leading global real estate investment manager with over 60 billion in real estate assets under management across core, value-added and opportunistic investment vehicles. REI acquires properties, operating companies, and real estate backed departments on a global scale on behalf of our institutional investors. The Off-Cycle Internship is an opportunity to experience the culture and atmosphere in the Investment Management Division by taking on some of the responsibilities and functions of a Full-time Analyst for a short period. This internship will offer you an exciting and a dynamic work environment where you get to work alongside our diverse group of experienced professionals. The work that you do will be interesting and varied. The internship will commence in January 2026 and typically lasts six months. TRAINING PROGRAM You will receive on-the-job training and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on a variety of projects. RESPONSIBILITIES Collecting and synthesizing financial and operating information about potential investment opportunities and industries Creating financial models Gathering market data to analyse trends and help value and price transactions Drafting presentations and memoranda for a wider audience within the Firm Attending team discussions and partner meetings, where you may be asked to deliver parts of a presentation QUALIFICATIONS/ SKILLS/ REQUIREMENTS You will have graduated by January 2026 and be able to commit for a full-time internship role for six months Ability to analyse and interpret complex information quickly and accurately Strong aptitude for numbers Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly Temperament that thrives under pressure and changing situations Strong analytical and numerical skills that put you at ease with financial data Results-driven and able to perform well under pressure and against tight deadlines Proven team player with the ability to manage a wide range of responsibilities. Committed to excellence in your work and maintain high professional and ethical standards Fluency in English and in the local language based on the location you are applying for WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY We have a track record of innovation and passion for unlocking new opportunities, we help our clients raise, manage and allocate capital. We do this by offering a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and asset management services. All that we do at Morgan Stanley is driven by our five core values: do the right thing, put clients first, lead with exceptional ideas, commit to diversity and inclusion, and give back. These arent just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day, ensuring we do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees around the world. And at the core of our success are the people who drive it relentless collaborators and creative thinkers who are fuelled by diverse thinking and experiences. Wherever you are in our 1,200 global offices, youll have the opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest in an environment where you are empowered to achieve your full potential. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. To learn more about our offices across the globe, please copy and paste https://www.morganstanley.com/aboutus/ global-offices into your browser.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
In the Investment Management division, we deliver active investment strategies across public and private markets and custom solutions to institutional and individual investors.

Since 1935, Morgan Stanley is known as a global leader in financial services, continuously evolving and innovating to better serve our clients and our communities in more than 40 countries around the world.

PLACEMENT AND DURATION

Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has about $1.7 trillion in assets under management or supervision. With 1,396 investment professionals worldwide, and 56 offices in 24 countries, MSIM is able to provide in-depth local knowledge and expertise while channeling the strength of our global presence and resources. To support the delivery of tailored, value-added investment solutions to clients our investment teams are organized by capability: equities, fixed income, multi-asset solutions, liquid alternatives and private markets. MSIM strives to provide outstanding long-term investment performance, service and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations and individuals worldwide.

Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing (REI) is Morgan Stanley's integrated global real estate practice. We are the world's leading global real estate investment manager with over $60 billion in real estate assets under management across core, value-added and opportunistic investment vehicles. REI acquires properties, operating companies, and real estate backed departments on a global scale on behalf of our institutional investors.

The Off-Cycle Internship is an opportunity to experience the culture and atmosphere in the Investment Management Division by taking on some of the responsibilities and functions of a Full-time Analyst for a short period. This internship will offer you an exciting and a dynamic work environment where you get to work alongside our diverse group of experienced professionals. The work that you do will be interesting and varied.

The internship will commence in January 2026 and typically lasts six months.

TRAINING PROGRAM

You will receive on-the-job training and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on a variety of projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Collecting and synthesizing financial and operating information about potential investment opportunities and industries
Creating financial models
Gathering market data to analyse trends and help value and price transactions
Drafting presentations and memoranda for a wider audience within the Firm
Attending team discussions and partner meetings, where you may be asked to deliver parts of a presentation

QUALIFICATIONS/ SKILLS/ REQUIREMENTS

You will have graduated by January 2026 and be able to commit for a full-time internship role for six months
Ability to analyse and interpret complex information quickly and accurately
Strong aptitude for numbers
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly
Temperament that thrives under pressure and changing situations
Strong analytical and numerical skills that put you at ease with financial data
Results-driven and able to perform well under pressure and against tight deadlines
Proven team player with the ability to manage a wide range of responsibilities.
Committed to excellence in your work and maintain high professional and ethical standards
Fluency in English and in the local language based on the location you are applying for

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY

We have a track record of innovation and passion for unlocking new opportunities, we help our clients raise, manage and allocate capital. We do this by offering a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and asset management services. All that we do at Morgan Stanley is driven by our five core values: do the right thing, put clients first, lead with exceptional ideas, commit to diversity and inclusion, and give back. These aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day, ensuring we do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees around the world. And at the core of our success are the people who drive it – relentless collaborators and creative thinkers who are fuelled by diverse thinking and experiences. Wherever you are in our 1,200 global offices, you’ll have the opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest in an environment where you are empowered to achieve your full potential. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. To learn more about our offices across the globe, please copy and paste https://www.morganstanley.com/aboutus/ global-offices into your browser.

Neste programa voc ter a oportunidade de aprender sobre o mercado financeiro, alm de conhecer os negcios do Morgan Stanley e entender melhor a rea com a qual voc se identifica O programa promover o networking para que voc expanda sua rede de relacionamento profissionais e tambm uma agenda de capacitaes semanais. Confira mais informaes: Disponibilidade para estagiar presencialmente por um perodo de 5 semanas Quando: Janeiro e Fevereiro de 2026 (5 de Janeiro a 6 de Fevereiro) Elegibilidade: Estudantes negros(as) com previso de graduao entre Dezembro/2027 e Julho/2029 - favor considerar a data final de formatura, incluindo possveis prorrogaes no momento da inscrio Perodo de Estgio: 5 de Janeiro a 6 de Fevereiro 2026 Benefcios: bolsa estgio, auxlio transporte, vale refeio, vale alimentao, seguro de vida, assistncia mdica Local de Trabalho: presencial em So Paulo (Av. Faria Lima, 3600) O PROCESSO SELETIVO DATAS IMPORTANTES 28/Julho: Abertura do Perodo de Inscries 26/Agosto: Webinar - Conhea mais sobre o Morgan Stanley 1/Setembro: Fechamento do Perodo de Inscries 6 a 15/Setembro: Perodo de Testes Outubro: Entrevistas Individuais A partir de Novembro: Retorno do Processo Seletivo A partir de Dezembro: Incio do Programa de Estgio 2026.1 5 de Janeiro de 2026: Incio do Programa de Frias: Cores Diversas 2026 Quer saber mais sobre o Morgan Stanley? Participe do Webinar no dia 26/08 s 18h Para isso, se inscreva no link antecipadamente em: https://morganstanley.zoom.us/webinar/register/WNRNgPtLiTa-3PjMmpoY1uw FAQ PERGUNTAS RECORRENTES Estou com dvidas sobre o processo de inscrio no programa. Quem devo chamar? Entrar em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com. Responderemos em horrio comercial do Brasil. Tenho dvidas sobre o Morgan Stanley e sobre o programa de estgio. O que devo fazer? Para saber mais sobre o Morgan Stanley e sobre o programa de estgio, participe do nosso Webinar no dia 26 de agosto, s 18h Inscries em: https://morganstanley.zoom.us/webinar/register/WNRNgPtLiTa-3PjMmpoY1uw. Posso me inscrever para o Programa de Estgio e para o Programa de Estgio de Frias ao mesmo tempo? No. Na hora de realizar sua inscrio, voc deve selecionar o programa que est aplicando. Por isso, s ser possvel considerar a candidatura para um nico programa. Quando realizar minha inscrio, posso escolher a rea que tenho interesse de atuar? Voc poder sinalizar as suas reas de preferncia, porm o direcionamento final ser feito pelo time interno do banco (RH e gestores), conforme disponibilidade de vagas. Planejo adiar a minha data de graduao na universidade. Quando realizar minha inscrio, devo considerar qual data? Quando for completar a sua inscrio no nosso sistema, favor considerar a sua data final de formatura, incluindo possveis prorrogaes. ATENO No ser possvel alterao dessa data aps a inscrio no programa. At quando posso me inscrever para o programa? As inscries para o Programa de Estgio Morgan Stanley Brasil 2026.1 e para o Programa de Estgio de Frias: Cores Diversas 2026 se encerram no dia 1 de setembro. Perdi o prazo das inscries. Posso aplicar de alguma outra forma? Cadidaturas realizadas aps o dia 01 de setembro no sero consideradas. . Caso voc tenha perdido o prazo das inscries e tenha interesse em fazer parte da equipe do Morgan Stanley, recomendamos que voc acompanhe os nossos canais oficiais de comunicao para no perder as inscries do nosso prximo programa. Posso enviar meu currculo diretamente ao recrutador ou ao time do Morgan Stanley? Para garantimos a avaliao correta e igualitria de todos os currculos, recebemos todas as candidaturas diretamente pelo post da vaga. Candidaturas realizadas fora desse canal no sero consideradas. Como consigo saber o prazo que terei para realizar os testes do programa? Voc receber um e-mail de HR LATAM Recruitment (hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com) com as orientaes para essa etapa e o prazo para ser concluda. Testes realizados aps esse prazo no sero considerados. Estou com problemas na resoluo do Hirevue (entrevista virtual). Quem devo chamar? Caso tenha algum problema quando estiver realizando a sua entrevista virtual, entre em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com. Responderemos em horrio comercial do Brasil. Estava realizando a etapa de testes online e minha internet caiu. O que eu fao? Entre novamente utilizando o site e login ID que foi disponibilizado e continue de onde parou. Por favor tenha em mente que isso no te dar tempo adicional para completar os testes. Quando fao login no site mostra que est invalido ou expirado. O que isso significa? Isso significa que voc no completou os testes no perodo que foi indicado pelo time de recrutamento e previamente informado por e-mail. Sua inscrio no ser mais considerada para esse programa, mas voc ser bem-vindo(a) para aplicar em um programa ou posio futura Continuo com problemas na resoluo dos testes online. Quem devo chamar? Caso tenha algum problema quando estiver respondendo os testes, entre em contato com o nosso parceiro AON em morganstanley.support@aon.com, com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com em cpia. O prazo de resposta deles de 4 horas em dias teis e 24 horas aos finais de semana. No poderei participar da entrevista individual com a rea pois tive um conflito de agenda. Quem devo avisar? Voc deve entrar em contato com a pessoa que realizou o agendamento, informar o problema e reagendar a entrevista. Para outras dvidas e mais informaes, entre em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
PROGRAMAS DE ESTÁGIO MORGAN STANLEY 2026.1

 

Nós acreditamos que o nosso maior ativo são as pessoas!

Uma carreira no Morgan Stanley significa pertencer à uma cultura impulsionada por novas ideias e visões para solução problemas complexos. Valorizamos um ambiente com foco em diversidade, inclusão e valorização das diferentes histórias e perspectivas.

 

ATENÇÃO! É importante que leia todas as informações abaixo antes de realizar a sua aplicação.

 

Temos oportunidades para dois programas de estágio no nosso escritório em São Paulo:

  • Programa de Estágio Regular: para candidatos(as) que tenham disponibilidade de estagiar por um período de 1 ano até 2 anos, em modelo híbrido/presencial (a depender da disponibilidade da área) no nosso escritório em São Paulo.
  • Programa de Estágio de Férias – Cores Diversas: voltado à inclusão de alunos(as) negros(as) no mercado financeiro. Para candidatos(as) que se autodeclarem pretos(as) ou pardos(as), que tenham disponibilidade de estagiar por um período de 5 semanas (5 de Janeiro a 6 de Fevereiro) presencialmente no nosso escritório em São Paulo.

IMPORTANTE: Você poderá poderá sinalizar suas áreas de preferência para estágio na etapa de inscrição, porém poderá ser selecionado(a) para trabalhar em qualquer área, conforme disponibilidade das vagas e direcionamento dos gestores e RH

Inscrições até 1 de Setembro!

 

PROGRAMA DE ESTÁGIO REGULAR MORGAN STANLEY BRASIL 2026.1

Confira mais informações:

  • Disponibilidade para estagiar por um período de 1 ano até 2 anos, em modelo híbrido/presencial (a depender da disponibilidade da área) no nosso escritório em São Paulo.
  • Elegibilidade: Graduação prevista entre Dezembro/2026 e Dezembro/2027 - favor considerar a data final de formatura, incluindo possíveis prorrogações no momento da inscrição
  • Idiomas: Inglês intermediário
  • Início: A partir de Dezembro de 2025
  • Benefícios: bolsa estágio, auxílio transporte, vale refeição, seguro de vida, assistência médica, assistência odontológica, auxílio para cursos de idiomas, vale alimentação, 13ª bolsa estágio e Wellhub
  • Local de trabalho: São Paulo (Av. Faria Lima, 3600)

 

PROGRAMA DE ESTÁGIO DE FÉRIAS MORGAN STANLEY BRASIL 2026: CORES DIVERSAS

O Programa de Estágio de Férias Morgan Stanley: Cores Diversas é parte integrante das nossas iniciativas de diversidade e inclusão. Neste programa você terá a oportunidade de aprender sobre o mercado financeiro, além de conhecer os negócios do Morgan Stanley e entender melhor a área com a qual você se identifica! O programa promoverá o networking para que você expanda sua rede de relacionamento profissionais e também uma agenda de capacitações semanais.

Confira mais informações:

  • Disponibilidade para estagiar presencialmente por um período de 5 semanas
  • Quando: Janeiro e Fevereiro de 2026 (5 de Janeiro a 6 de Fevereiro)
  • Elegibilidade: Estudantes negros(as) com previsão de graduação entre Dezembro/2027 e Julho/2029 - favor considerar a data final de formatura, incluindo possíveis prorrogações no momento da inscrição
  • Período de Estágio: 5 de Janeiro a 6 de Fevereiro 2026
  • Benefícios: bolsa estágio, auxílio transporte, vale refeição, vale alimentação, seguro de vida, assistência médica
  • Local de Trabalho: presencial em São Paulo (Av. Faria Lima, 3600)

 

O PROCESSO SELETIVO – DATAS IMPORTANTES

  • 28/Julho: Abertura do Período de Inscrições
  • 26/Agosto: Webinar - Conheça mais sobre o Morgan Stanley!
  • 1/Setembro: Fechamento do Período de Inscrições
  • 6 a 15/Setembro: Período de Testes
  • Outubro: Entrevistas Individuais
  • A partir de Novembro: Retorno do Processo Seletivo
  • A partir de Dezembro: Início do Programa de Estágio 2026.1
  • 5 de Janeiro de 2026: Início do Programa de Férias: Cores Diversas 2026

 

Quer saber mais sobre o Morgan Stanley? Participe do Webinar no dia 26/08 às 18h!

Para isso, se inscreva no link antecipadamente em: https://morganstanley.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_RN_gPtLiTa-3PjMmpoY1uw

 

 

FAQ – PERGUNTAS RECORRENTES

  • Estou com dúvidas sobre o processo de inscrição no programa. Quem devo chamar?

Entrar em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com. Responderemos em horário comercial do Brasil.

  • Tenho dúvidas sobre o Morgan Stanley e sobre o programa de estágio. O que devo fazer?

Para saber mais sobre o Morgan Stanley e sobre o programa de estágio, participe do nosso Webinar no dia 26 de agosto, às 18h! Inscrições em: https://morganstanley.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_RN_gPtLiTa-3PjMmpoY1uw.

  • Posso me inscrever para o Programa de Estágio e para o Programa de Estágio de Férias ao mesmo tempo?

Não. Na hora de realizar sua inscrição, você deve selecionar o programa que está aplicando. Por isso, só será possível considerar a candidatura para um único programa.

  • Quando realizar minha inscrição, posso escolher a área que tenho interesse de atuar?

Você poderá sinalizar as suas áreas de preferência, porém o direcionamento final será feito pelo time interno do banco (RH e gestores), conforme disponibilidade de vagas.

  • Planejo adiar a minha data de graduação na universidade. Quando realizar minha inscrição, devo considerar qual data?

Quando for completar a sua inscrição no nosso sistema, favor considerar a sua data final de formatura, incluindo possíveis prorrogações. ATENÇÃO! Não será possível alteração dessa data após a inscrição no programa.

  • Até quando posso me inscrever para o programa?

As inscrições para o Programa de Estágio Morgan Stanley Brasil 2026.1 e para o Programa de Estágio de Férias: Cores Diversas 2026 se encerram no dia 1 de setembro.

  • Perdi o prazo das inscrições. Posso aplicar de alguma outra forma?

Cadidaturas realizadas após o dia 01 de setembro não serão consideradas. . Caso você tenha perdido o prazo das inscrições e tenha interesse em fazer parte da equipe do Morgan Stanley, recomendamos que você acompanhe os nossos canais oficiais de comunicação para não perder as inscrições do nosso próximo programa.

  • Posso enviar meu currículo diretamente ao recrutador ou ao time do Morgan Stanley?

Para garantimos a avaliação correta e igualitária de todos os currículos, recebemos todas as candidaturas diretamente pelo post da vaga. Candidaturas realizadas fora desse canal não serão consideradas.

  • Como consigo saber o prazo que terei para realizar os testes do programa? 

Você receberá um e-mail de HR LATAM Recruitment (hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com) com as orientações para essa etapa e o prazo para ser concluída. Testes realizados após esse prazo não serão considerados.

  • Estou com problemas na resolução do Hirevue (entrevista virtual). Quem devo chamar?

Caso tenha algum problema quando estiver realizando a sua entrevista virtual, entre em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com. Responderemos em horário comercial do Brasil.

  • Estava realizando a etapa de testes online e minha internet caiu. O que eu faço?

Entre novamente utilizando o site e login ID que foi disponibilizado e continue de onde parou. Por favor tenha em mente que isso não te dará tempo adicional para completar os testes.

  • Quando faço login no site mostra que está invalido ou expirado. O que isso significa?

Isso significa que você não completou os testes no período que foi indicado pelo time de recrutamento e previamente informado por e-mail. Sua inscrição não será mais considerada para esse programa, mas você será bem-vindo(a) para aplicar em um programa ou posição futura!

  • Continuo com problemas na resolução dos testes online. Quem devo chamar?

Caso tenha algum problema quando estiver respondendo os testes, entre em contato com o nosso parceiro AON em morganstanley.support@aon.com, com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com em cópia. O prazo de resposta deles é de 4 horas em dias úteis e 24 horas aos finais de semana.

  • Não poderei participar da entrevista individual com a área pois tive um conflito de agenda. Quem devo avisar?

Você deve entrar em contato com a pessoa que realizou o agendamento, informar o problema e reagendar a entrevista.

 

Para outras dúvidas e mais informações, entre em contato com hrlatamrecruitment@morganstanley.com

resultSet.jobDescription: In the Investment Banking division, we offer Global expertise in market analysis and in advisory and capital-raising services for corporations, institutions, and governments. Since 1935, Morgan Stanley is known as a global leader in financial services, continuously evolving and innovating to better serve our clients and our communities in more than 40 countries around the world. PLACEMENT AND DURATION The Investment Banking Off-cycle Internship is an opportunity to experience the culture and atmosphere in the Investment Banking Division (IBD) by taking on some of the responsibilities and functions of a Full-time Analyst for a short period. The internship typically lasts three to six months but can vary in length depending on business needs and candidate availability. You will spend your internship assigned to a specific group in a specific region, building basic skills in financial analysis, accounting, and valuation, while working on a wide range of domestic and international transactions. TRAINING PROGRAM You will receive on-the-job training and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on a variety of projects. RESPONSIBILITIES Gathering and synthesising financial and operating information about companies, industries, and governments. Creating and updating financial models. Gathering market data to analyse trends and help value and price transactions. Drafting presentations and memoranda for a wider audience within the Firm and the financial services industry. Attending team discussions and client meetings, where you may be asked to deliver parts of a presentation. QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS You have strong analytical and numerical skills that put You at ease with financial data. You are results-driven, and perform well under pressure and against tight deadlines. You are a proven team player and can manage a wide range of responsibilities. You have an excellent academic background and fluency in English. Ability to communicate effectively in multiple languages is an advantage. You articulate complex ideas simply and summarise them effectively. You are committed to excellence in your work and maintain high professional and ethical standards. APPLICATION DEADLINE We recruit on a rolling basis so application is encouraged as soon as possible. We aim to review all applications within a timely manner, however our response times may vary due to high volumes. Please be assured that you will receive an update via email as soon as a decision on your application has been reached, and kindly note we are unable to accommodate any requests to accelerate the timelines of our application process. Salary is competitive with excellent benefits. WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY We have a track record of innovation and passion for unlocking new opportunities, we help our clients raise, manage and allocate capital. We do this by offering a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and asset management services. All that we do at Morgan Stanley is driven by our five core values: do the right thing, put clients first, lead with exceptional ideas, commit to diversity and inclusion, and give back. These arent just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day, ensuring we do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees around the world. And at the core of our success are the people who drive it relentless collaborators and creative thinkers who are fuelled by diverse thinking and experiences. Wherever you are in our 1,200 global offices, youll have the opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest in an environment where you are empowered to achieve your full potential. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. To learn more about our offices across the globe, please copy and paste https://www.morganstanley.com/aboutus/ global-offices into your browser.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
In the Investment Banking division, we offer Global expertise in market analysis and in
advisory and capital-raising services for corporations, institutions, and governments.

Since 1935, Morgan Stanley is known as a global leader in financial services, continuously evolving and innovating to better
serve our clients and our communities in more than 40 countries around the world.

PLACEMENT AND DURATION

The Investment Banking Off-cycle Internship is an opportunity to experience the culture and atmosphere in the Investment Banking Division (IBD) by taking on some of the responsibilities and functions of a Full-time Analyst for a short period. The internship typically lasts three to six months but can vary in length depending on business needs and candidate availability. You will spend your internship assigned to a specific group in a specific region, building basic skills in financial analysis, accounting, and valuation, while working on a wide range of domestic and international transactions.

TRAINING PROGRAM

You will receive on-the-job training and benefit from working alongside experienced professionals on a variety of projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Gathering and synthesising financial and operating information about companies, industries, and governments.
  • Creating and updating financial models.
  • Gathering market data to analyse trends and help value and price transactions.
  • Drafting presentations and memoranda for a wider audience within the Firm and the financial services industry.
  • Attending team discussions and client meetings, where you may be asked to deliver parts of a presentation.

QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS

  • You have strong analytical and numerical skills that put You at ease with financial data.
  • You are results-driven, and perform well under pressure and against tight deadlines.
  • You are a proven team player and can manage a wide range of responsibilities.
  • You have an excellent academic background and fluency in English.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in multiple languages is an advantage.
  • You articulate complex ideas simply and summarise them effectively.
  • You are committed to excellence in your work and maintain high professional and ethical standards.

APPLICATION DEADLINE

We recruit on a rolling basis so application is encouraged as soon as possible. We aim to review all applications within a timely manner, however our response times may vary due to high volumes. Please be assured that you will receive an update via email as soon as a decision on your application has been reached, and kindly note we are unable to accommodate any requests to accelerate the timelines of our application process. 

* Salary is competitive with excellent benefits.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY

We have a track record of innovation and passion for unlocking new opportunities, we help our clients raise, manage and allocate capital. We do this by offering a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management and asset management services. All that we do at Morgan Stanley is driven by our five core values: do the right thing, put clients first, lead with exceptional ideas, commit to diversity and inclusion, and give back. These aren’t just beliefs, they guide the decisions we make every day, ensuring we do what's best for our clients, communities and more than 80,000 employees around the world. And at the core of our success are the people who drive it – relentless collaborators and creative thinkers who are fuelled by diverse thinking and experiences. Wherever you are in our 1,200 global offices, you’ll have the opportunity to work alongside the best and the brightest in an environment where you are empowered to achieve your full potential. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. To learn more about our offices across the globe, please copy and paste https://www.morganstanley.com/aboutus/ global-offices into your browser.

resultSet.jobTitle: 2025 Legal and Compliance Full-Time Analyst Program (Hong Kong)
resultSet.jobDescription: The Full-Time Analyst Program is a 3-year rotational program beginning in fall 2025. The Full-Time Analyst will be placed into the Legal & Compliance Division. The mission of the Division is to assist Morgan Stanley in achieving its business objectives in a manner consistent with the Firm's core values and Global Risk Management Principles, by facilitating and overseeing the Firm's management of legal, regulatory and franchise risk. Legal Department advises the Firm on legal, regulatory and franchise risk, including litigation and regulatory enforcement matters, corporate governance, and Firm transactions. Non-Financial Risk Department manages risks which are not financial in nature, and could have a potential economic, reputational, regulatory, financial reporting, or client impact from (i) failed or inadequate processes, data, or controls; ii) infrastructure or environmental factors; or iii) intentional or inadvertent actions of employees or external parties. Non-Financial Risk Department includes Global Compliance, Global Financial Crimes, Operational Risk and Asia Data Governance and provides a single, comprehensive, and consistent second-line view of these non-financial risks. Training Program Realize your full potential at Morgan Stanley through out campus programs. This comprehensive program includes a Firmwide orientation to Morgan Stanleys businesses and on-the-job training. You will also have many opportunities to integrate with peers and senior colleagues through a series of networking, social, charity and mentoring events. Role and Responsibilities Assisting in day-to-day risk management of operational risk exposures by providing analysis of business activities and establishing processes and tools to monitor these risks under the supervision of experienced professionals Contributing to due diligence reviews (for example, financial crimes concerns) of clients during the account opening process Contributing to monitoring and surveillance of transactions, employee activities and communications Participating in transaction and control-based testing of Firm processes and controls to mitigate risks Providing support in analyzing regulations, rules and various proposals as well as drafting and coordinating regulatory updates and compliance bulletins Conducting research and assisting with responses to various regulatory inquiries and examinations Assisting the relevant team to review and draft policies, procedures, compliance manuals and develop/update related training courses Participating in compliance risk assessments and analyzing the compliance environment and controls for a line of business Working under the direction and supervision of attorneys on assignments incorporating various aspects of a legal practice Assisting attorneys and collaborating with other teams in the Legal & Compliance Division to support the Firm and its businesses Qualifications and Skills You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelors or Master's degree with a graduation date between June 2025 and October 2025. Students from any degree / discipline are welcome to apply You have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 Track record of academic excellence Excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage competing priorities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to analyze and synthesize a variety of data to produce well-designed, meaningful summaries and reports Adept at solving problems and developing efficient processes Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word Fluency in English required, and Asian language skills preferred Application Process and Deadline Application Process: CV Submission On-Demand Video Interview Superday Application deadline: August 31, 2025 Applications will be closed at 23:55 HKT Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready because interviews and offers can occur prior to the application period closing.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
The Full-Time Analyst Program is a 3-year rotational program beginning in fall 2025. The Full-Time Analyst will be placed into the Legal & Compliance Division. The mission of the Division is to assist Morgan Stanley in achieving its business objectives in a manner consistent with the Firm's core values and Global Risk Management Principles, by facilitating and overseeing the Firm's management of legal, regulatory and franchise risk. 

Legal Department advises the Firm on legal, regulatory and franchise risk, including litigation and regulatory enforcement matters, corporate governance, and Firm transactions. 

Non-Financial Risk Department manages risks which are not financial in nature, and could have a potential economic, reputational, regulatory, financial reporting, or client impact from (i) failed or inadequate processes, data, or controls; ii) infrastructure or environmental factors; or iii) intentional or inadvertent actions of employees or external parties. Non-Financial Risk Department includes Global Compliance, Global Financial Crimes, Operational Risk and Asia Data Governance and provides a single, comprehensive, and consistent second-line view of these non-financial risks. 

Training Program

Realize your full potential at Morgan Stanley through out campus programs. 

This comprehensive program includes a Firmwide orientation to Morgan Stanley’s businesses and on-the-job training. You will also have many opportunities to integrate with peers and senior colleagues through a series of networking, social, charity and mentoring events.

Role and Responsibilities

  • Assisting in day-to-day risk management of operational risk exposures by providing analysis of business activities and establishing processes and tools to monitor these risks under the supervision of experienced professionals
  • Contributing to due diligence reviews (for example, financial crimes concerns) of clients during the account opening process
  • Contributing to monitoring and surveillance of transactions, employee activities and communications
  • Participating in transaction and control-based testing of Firm processes and controls to mitigate risks
  • Providing support in analyzing regulations, rules and various proposals as well as drafting and coordinating regulatory updates and compliance bulletins
  • Conducting research and assisting with responses to various regulatory inquiries and examinations
  • Assisting the relevant team to review and draft policies, procedures, compliance manuals and develop/update related training courses
  • Participating in compliance risk assessments and analyzing the compliance environment and controls for a line of business
  • Working under the direction and supervision of attorneys on assignments incorporating various aspects of a legal practice
  • Assisting attorneys and collaborating with other teams in the Legal & Compliance Division to support the Firm and its businesses

Qualifications and Skills

  • You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelor’s or Master's degree with a graduation date between June 2025 and October 2025. Students from any degree / discipline are welcome to apply
  • You have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
  • Track record of academic excellence
  • Excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage competing priorities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to analyze and synthesize a variety of data to produce well-designed, meaningful summaries and reports
  • Adept at solving problems and developing efficient processes
  • Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word
  • Fluency in English required, and Asian language skills preferred

Application Process and Deadline 

  • Application Process:
    1. CV Submission
    2. On-Demand Video Interview
    3. Superday
  • Application deadline: August 31, 2025
  • Applications will be closed at 23:55 HKT

Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready because interviews and offers can occur prior to the application period closing.

resultSet.jobTitle: 2026 Investment Management Summer Analyst Program - Equity Research (Boston)
resultSet.jobDescription: Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has more than 1,400 investment professionals around the world and 1.7 trillion in assets under management or supervision as of June 30, 2025. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide strong long-term investment performance, outstanding service, and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations, and individuals worldwide. General Description The Investment Management Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week program starting in June. The program consists of one week of training and nine weeks working within a specific IM team. Across all IM teams, the curriculum is designed to equip Summer Analysts with the fundamental skills they need to be successful in IM. During the 10-week program, Summer Analysts experience the culture and atmosphere of Morgan Stanley by performing a role similar to a Full-Time Analyst. This role within Eaton Vance Equity, part of the MSIM Active Fundamental Equity group, will work directly with portfolio managers and analysts on research projects throughout the summer. Primary Responsibilities Support portfolio managers and equity analysts in their daily work. Provide basic research as needed on sectors, industries, and companies Attend investment meetings, company meetings, and industry specialist meetings Work on special projects as needed within Eaton Vance Equity Learn to use various market data systems Assist in preparing financial models (including income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement, and valuation) from data in company filings and other publicly available information Extract specific data needed from financial reports and databases to prepare or update models relating to specific industries and companies followed by analysts Perform additional responsibilities as requested Job Requirements Pursuing a Bachelor's degree with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027 Strong analytical skills and eagerness to learn Ability to function independently and to collaborate effectively Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage time efficiently and effectively Detail-oriented, accurate, reliable, proactive Application Process and Deadline In order to be considered, candidates must apply with their resume through the Morgan Stanley website and complete their HireVue digital questionnaire. Resumes will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the role is filled or the application deadline, whichever comes first. Applications must be submitted by Friday, August 29, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST and HireVues completed by Sunday, August 31, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST in order to be considered. Expected base pay rates for the role will be 52.89 per hour at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
Morgan Stanley Investment Management (“MSIM”), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has more than 1,400 investment professionals around the world and $1.7 trillion in assets under management or supervision as of June 30, 2025. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide strong long-term investment performance, outstanding service, and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations, and individuals worldwide.

General Description
The Investment Management Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week program starting in June. The program consists of one week of training and nine weeks working within a specific IM team. Across all IM teams, the curriculum is designed to equip Summer Analysts with the fundamental skills they need to be successful in IM. During the 10-week program, Summer Analysts experience the culture and atmosphere of Morgan Stanley by performing a role similar to a Full-Time Analyst.

This role within Eaton Vance Equity, part of the MSIM Active Fundamental Equity group, will work directly with portfolio managers and analysts on research projects throughout the summer.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Support portfolio managers and equity analysts in their daily work.
  • Provide basic research as needed on sectors, industries, and companies
  • Attend investment meetings, company meetings, and industry specialist meetings
  • Work on special projects as needed within Eaton Vance Equity
  • Learn to use various market data systems
  • Assist in preparing financial models (including income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement, and valuation) from data in company filings and other publicly available information
  • Extract specific data needed from financial reports and databases to prepare or update models relating to specific industries and companies followed by analysts
  • Perform additional responsibilities as requested


Job Requirements

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027
  • Strong analytical skills and eagerness to learn
  • Ability to function independently and to collaborate effectively
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage time efficiently and effectively
  • Detail-oriented, accurate, reliable, proactive


Application Process and Deadline
In order to be considered, candidates must apply with their resume through the Morgan Stanley website and complete their HireVue digital questionnaire. Resumes will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the role is filled or the application deadline, whichever comes first. Applications must be submitted by Friday, August 29, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST and HireVues completed by Sunday, August 31, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST in order to be considered.

Expected base pay rates for the role will be $52.89 per hour at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

resultSet.jobTitle: 2026 Investment Management Summer Analyst Program - Fixed Income High Yield (Boston)
resultSet.jobDescription: Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has more than 1,400 investment professionals around the world and 1.6 trillion in assets under management or supervision as of September 30, 2024. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide strong long-term investment performance, outstanding service, and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations, and individuals worldwide. General Description The Investment Management Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week program starting in June. The program consists of one week of training and nine weeks working within a specific IM team. Across all IM teams, the curriculum is designed to equip Summer Analysts with the fundamental skills they need to be successful in IM. During the 10-week program, Summer Analysts experience the culture and atmosphere of Morgan Stanley by performing a role similar to a Full-Time Analyst. The High Yield internship program is intended for talented individuals pursuing an undergraduate degree in a related field. Successful candidates have demonstrated interest in financial markets, economics and/or international affairs. Interns in the High Yield group will provide the department with research assistance by working with portfolio managers, analysts, and operations associates. Primary Responsibilities Support portfolio managers, high yield analysts and research associates in their daily work. At a high-level, this includes: (i) analysis of industry fundamentals and outlooks, and (ii) conducting in-depth fundamental research on individual company business models, operating strategies and outlooks. Participate in daily investment team meetings and company reviews called in response to primary issuance or a secondary market opportunity. Build and maintain proprietary financial models from data contained in company filings (e.g., 10-Ks, 10-Qs) and other data sources (e.g., Bloomberg, S&P CapitalIQ, industry-specific information providers). Create spreadsheets and macros that compile information from multiple spreadsheets and databases into unified reports. Work on special projects within the High Yield Department (e.g., optimizing and screening investment opportunities; assessing portfolio risk exposure; compiling regulatory information). Perform additional assignments as requested. Job Requirements Pursuing a Bachelor's degree with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027 Strong academic record and extracurricular achievements Outstanding oral and written communication skills Strong Excel skills Experience modeling corporate financial statements (income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements), preferably from a credit perspective The ability to function reliably and independently with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail Understanding of the corporate bond and equity markets Application Process and Deadline In order to be considered, candidates must apply with their resume through the Morgan Stanley website and complete their HireVue digital questionnaire. Resumes will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the role is filled or the application deadline, whichever comes first. Applications must be submitted by Friday, August 29, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST and HireVues completed by Sunday, August 31, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST in order to be considered. Expected base pay rates for the role will be 52.89 per hour at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.
resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
Morgan Stanley Investment Management (“MSIM”), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has more than 1,400 investment professionals around the world and $1.6 trillion in assets under management or supervision as of September 30, 2024. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide strong long-term investment performance, outstanding service, and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations, and individuals worldwide.

General Description
The Investment Management Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week program starting in June. The program consists of one week of training and nine weeks working within a specific IM team. Across all IM teams, the curriculum is designed to equip Summer Analysts with the fundamental skills they need to be successful in IM. During the 10-week program, Summer Analysts experience the culture and atmosphere of Morgan Stanley by performing a role similar to a Full-Time Analyst.

The High Yield internship program is intended for talented individuals pursuing an undergraduate degree in a related field. Successful candidates have demonstrated interest in financial markets, economics and/or international affairs. Interns in the High Yield group will provide the department with research assistance by working with portfolio managers, analysts, and operations associates.

Primary Responsibilities

  1. Support portfolio managers, high yield analysts and research associates in their daily work. At a high-level, this includes:
    • (i) analysis of industry fundamentals and outlooks, and
    • (ii) conducting in-depth fundamental research on individual company business models, operating strategies and outlooks.
  2. Participate in daily investment team meetings and company reviews called in response to primary issuance or a secondary market opportunity.
  3. Build and maintain proprietary financial models from data contained in company filings (e.g., 10-Ks, 10-Qs) and other data sources (e.g., Bloomberg, S&P CapitalIQ, industry-specific information providers).
  4. Create spreadsheets and macros that compile information from multiple spreadsheets and databases into unified reports.
  5. Work on special projects within the High Yield Department (e.g., optimizing and screening investment opportunities; assessing portfolio risk exposure; compiling regulatory information).
    Perform additional assignments as requested.


Job Requirements

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and June 2027
  • Strong academic record and extracurricular achievements
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Experience modeling corporate financial statements (income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements), preferably from a credit perspective
  • The ability to function reliably and independently with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Understanding of the corporate bond and equity markets


Application Process and Deadline
In order to be considered, candidates must apply with their resume through the Morgan Stanley website and complete their HireVue digital questionnaire. Resumes will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the role is filled or the application deadline, whichever comes first. Applications must be submitted by Friday, August 29, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST and HireVues completed by Sunday, August 31, 2025 at 11:55 PM EST in order to be considered.

Expected base pay rates for the role will be $52.89 per hour at the commencement of employment. resultSet.jobHtmlDescription:
2026 Operations Full-Time Analyst Program (Sandy & South Jordan)
The Operations Division at Morgan Stanley is the front line of defense for the Firm's financial and operational well-being and works closely with almost all departments in order to safeguard the Firm's reputation and franchise. Operations partners with Sales & Trading, Finance, Legal, and Technology to execute the Firm's institutional, retail, and asset management businesses - via supporting and settling daily transactions, devising and implementing effective controls, developing strong client relationships, and engaging with its business partners to enable development of new structures, businesses, and markets.

Training Program:
• Opportunities to join in January or July of each year depending on your graduation date
• An entry-level opportunity to learn about the Financial Services Industry and develop necessary professional competencies to be successful within Operations
• A Full-Time Analyst Training Program, which includes a Firm orientation, followed by financial, technical, and professional skills training
• Opportunities to develop your professional network through seminars with senior management, social and networking events, and mentorship.

Role and Responsibilities:
• Collaborate across the various Ops teams to evaluate and reengineer processes to drive greater operational efficiency.
• Partner with business units and technology to deliver exceptional service to our clients in the areas of trade capture, clearance and settlement, account opening, cash management, billing, tax reporting and fraud monitoring.
• Partner with Technology to design, manage and implement business process changes to streamline processes, improve productivity and optimize operational efficiency.
• Effectively identify and mitigate operational risk while ensuring continued compliance with global regulatory requirements
• Establish and maintain effective client relationships in order to deliver world class operational services
• Upon completion of training, analysts will be assigned to a team within Operations in accordance with business needs

Qualifications and Skills:
• Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
• Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree and graduating between December 2025 and June 2026
• Excellent leadership, analytical, and communication skills
• Team player who can work in a collaborative environment
• Attention to detail, exercise sound judgment and can handle sensitive information with discretion
• Strong time management and multitasking skills and can handle multiple responsibilities and projects with competing priorities and deadline
• Problem solving skills and the ability to streamline processes in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
• Positive, can-do attitude and willingness to get the job done
• Proactive, motivated, and possess poise and self-confidence
• All majors (disciplines) are encouraged to apply

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

Application Process & Deadline: (Sandy & South Jordan, UT) October 31, 2025

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Expected base pay rates for the role will be $55,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).
